text:
Hello,

can anyone help me here?

`{{ coursemodule.tostartby }}` -> this is working fine
`{{coursemodule.tostartby|format_date('<http://yyyyy.MM|yyyyy.MM>.dd') }}` -> this gives blank output
`{{ coursemodule.tostartby|pprint }}` -> this gives `(String: 30/04/23)`
are you using this in a loop?

I'm trying to pull from the default companies contact list -- right now my hubl code is referencing a custom list   `{% set projects = crm_objects("p2347991_projects",` 

Does anyone know how to swap this to companies? I tried to replace `p2347991_projects` to `company` per the docs but no go.. not sure!
The URL for the company list is also <http://app.HubSpot.com/contacts/2347991/companies|app.HubSpot.com/contacts/2347991/companies> so do I need to use the 2347991 somewhere?
nope that's the portal id

Here's the HubL:
```{% set objects = crm_objects("company", "", "name") %}```
that's what i thought but `{% set projects = crm_objects("company",` doesn't work :disappointed:
Hmm strange

I've tried doing `{% set objects = crm_objects("company", "", "name") %}`


 but nothing being populated in the for loop
Name should also be default value per docs
what happens if you just print it out like this `{{ objects }}`
{has_more=false, offset=0, total=0, results=[]}
strange that zero results
Do you have companies in HubSpot?
Yes, multiple records in contacts -> companies
Do you want double check for me? I just ran that code and it worked fine
I can confirm the portal id works on a custom project
is this the same portal though?
Yes
That companies tab is me just clicking after the contacts dropdown, default one
This is strictly hypothetical — the use case I had in mind was using this technique in global partials to allow for different module content per subdomain.
Hey all, Is there a limit on the number of definitions I can get back with "crm_property_definitions"?
Im attempting to pull 414, but missing the last 1
oh interesting
I'm wondering if it's the number of records
it could be -- i tried doing a `limit=350` or some other variations but so far nothing

Your `pprint` output says that your date property is currently stored as a string — the `format_date` filter only takes date objects. You’ll need to pass it through <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#strtotime|the >`strtotime`<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/filters#strtotime| filter> to coerce it to a date before passing it into `format_date`.

As a side note, you’re probably looking for the `yyyy` year format, rather than the `yyyyy` format. The documentation uses the latter, but I doubt your courses are starting after the year 10,000. ;~)
Would love to know if anyone winds up finding an answer to this. I could not, for the life of me, figure out a way to make this work.
Good morning group how are you?, how can I call an image in a module that I am developing from scratch, thank you so much for the reply
CC <@U25PYL3Q8> any reason that this might happen?
If we are querying companies — it needs to be on a private page/membership page
<@U04J0PBLS3H> is that what is going on here?
for my testing no but it will be; i can redo it on a private page to see if it works
so you're saying functionality won't actually work if its a live page? for security reasons
public live
<@U04U9MJUQKB> Sorry, Missed this
Did you find a way?
`{{ module.image_field }}`

or

`{% if module.image_field.src %}`
	`{% set sizeAttrs = 'width="{{ module.image_field.width }}" height="{{ module.image_field.height }}"' %}`
	`{% if module.image_field.size_type == 'auto' %}`
		`{% set sizeAttrs = 'width="{{ module.image_field.width }}" height="{{ module.image_field.height }}" style="max-width: 100%; height: auto;"' %}`
	`{% elif module.image_field.size_type == 'auto_custom_max' %}`
		`{% set sizeAttrs = 'width="{{ module.image_field.max_width }}" height="{{ module.image_field.max_height }}" style="max-width: 100%; height: auto;"' %}`
	`{% endif %}`
	 `{% set loadingAttr = module.image_field.loading != 'disabled' ? 'loading="{{ module.image_field.loading }}"' : '' %}`
	`<img src="{{ module.image_field.src }}" alt="{{ module.image_field.alt }}" {{ loadingAttr }} {{ sizeAttrs }}>`
`{% endif %}`


When you are using a field what I should suggest when creating a module
